title: A Dutch court is delivering verdicts in the trial of 9 suspects in the slaying of reporter De Vries
message:
A Dutch court is delivering verdicts in the trial of 9 suspects in the slaying of reporter De VriesFILE - Dutch crime reporter Peter R. de Vries looks on prior to attending a live TV show in Amsterdam, Netherlands, on Jan. 31, 2008.
A Dutch court is delivering verdicts Wednesday, June 12, 2024 in the trial of nine men suspected of involvement in the 2021 assassination of popular campaigning journalist Peter R. de Vries on a downtown Amsterdam street.
(AP Photo/Peter Dejong, File)AMSTERDAM (AP) — A Dutch court is delivering verdicts Wednesday in the trial of nine men suspected of involvement in the assassination three years ago of popular campaigning journalist Peter R. de Vries on a busy Amsterdam street.
In January, prosecutors requested sentences ranging from three to 21 years for the six other suspects in the case.
Prosecutors told judges at Amsterdam District Court that the weapon used to shoot de Vries was found in their car.

title: A Dutch court is delivering verdicts in the trial of 9 suspects in the slaying of reporter De Vries
message:
AMSTERDAM (AP) — A Dutch court is delivering verdicts Wednesday in the trial of nine men suspected of involvement in the assassination three years ago of popular campaigning journalist Peter R. de Vries on a busy Amsterdam street.
Prosecutors have sought convictions and life sentences for the man charged with gunning down De Vries on July 6, 2021, the alleged getaway driver and a man suspected of organizing the assassination.
In January, prosecutors requested sentences ranging from three to 21 years for the six other suspects in the case.
Judges called him the “undisputed leader” of a “murder organization.”Taghi has not been charged with involvement in the assassination of De Vries and prosecutors have not charged any suspects with ordering him killed.
Prosecutors told judges at Amsterdam District Court that the weapon used to shoot de Vries was found in their car.

message:

In January, prosecutors requested sentences ranging from three to 21 years for the six other suspects in the case.
De Vries had been an adviser and confidant for a protected witness in the trial of the alleged leader and other members of a crime gang.

title: Verdict due in Dutch crime reporter killing
message:
Peter R. de Vries was a household name in the Netherlands (Remko de Waal)A Dutch court will on Wednesday hand down a long-awaited verdict over the 2021 assassination of high-profile crime journalist Peter R. de Vries, a killing that shocked the country.
Police arrested two suspects, identified only as Dutchman Delano G. and Kamil E. from Poland, shortly after the shooting.
The celebrity journalist then moved into television, where he ran his own crime programme called "Peter R. de Vries, Crime Reporter".
Crown Princess Amalia, the daughter of King Willem-Alexander, was forced to move to Spain for her studies due to fears of an attack from an organised crime group.
Both the royal and Prime Minister Mark Rutte were mentioned in messages by organised crime groups, raising fears of plans to kidnap or attack them.

title: On the 250th day of war , martyrs and injuries reported in central Gaza
message:
The Israeli occupation intensified its targeting of areas in the central Gaza Strip, in addition to its bombing of other regions, which resulted in many martyrs.
(AP)On the 250th consecutive day, the Israeli occupation persists in its devastating campaign against the Gaza Strip, conducting bombings and raids across multiple regions, leading to further casualties.
The occupation also targeted several areas in the central Gaza Strip, with helicopters firing heavy machine-gun fire around the Wadi Gaza Bridge.
The intense Israeli artillery shelling also targeted the east of Khan Younis, south of the Gaza Strip, as reported by Al Mayadeen’s correspondent.
In its daily report, the Health Ministry mentioned that the Israeli occupation forces committed three massacres within 24 hours, killing 40 Palestinians and injuring 120 others.

title: Lake Berryessa shooting suspect arrested by Napa County authorities
message:
A North Bay man was arrested on suspicion of fatally shooting another person during a brawl at Lake Berryessa on Saturday, according to a news release from the Napa County Sheriff’s Office.
One person was fatally shot and at least five people were stabbed during a large fight June 8 on the shore of Lake Berryessa, the Napa County Sheriff’s Office said.
The shooting victim was identified as Andrew Fabian Sandoval Garcia, a 39-year-old Vallejo resident.
According to Sheriff’s Office spokesman Henry Wofford, two people with stab wounds were airlifted to local hospitals in serious condition.
The cause of the fight and how many people were involved has yet to be determined by investigators.

title: Hamas leader suggests civilian deaths are  necessary sacrifice in war with Israel : Report | News
message:
Yahya Sinwar, the military leader of Hamas, reportedly suggested civilian deaths are "necessary sacrifices" amid its war with Israel in a message to the terrorist organization's leaders in Doha, Qatar.
The war between Hamas and Israel, much of it taking place within Gaza and the West Bank, has resulted in thousands of civilian deaths.
But Sinwar's remarks, reported by the Wall Street Journal, indicate that Hamas is willing to continue its war with Israel despite the heavy civilian cost.
The report also suggests that with the growing backlash Israel is facing over civilian deaths, he believes Hamas could deal with a depleted Israeli arsenal as allies hesitate to supply the nation further.
Featured Local SavingsHamas began the recent conflict with its Oct. 7 attacks on Israel, which killed hundreds of Israeli military personnel and citizens.

title: BREAKING : IDF Eliminates Senior Hezbollah Official ; Highest Ranking Officer Neutralized Since Oct . 7
message:
Posted on by SeekAndFindReports are emerging that the IDF hit a significant Hezbollah target in Lebanon on Tuesday afternoon.
According to the reports, an Israeli strike in Jouya, in southern Lebanon, killed at least four Hezbollah officials.
Hezbollah identified the killed commander by his rank in a statement, naming him as Taleb Abdallah.
The sources, who spoke on condition of anonymity, said the commander's role in Hezbollah was as significant as that of Wissam Tawil, a senior Hezbollah commander killed in an Israeli strike in January.
MAJOR UPDATE: The IDF had intel about the Hezbollah senior commander's secret meeting; they hit the meeting place and took out two of their most senior commanders.

title: 4 killed in Israeli airstrike on SE Lebanese town
message:
BEIRUT, June 11 (Xinhua) -- Four people were killed and 10 others injured late Tuesday in an Israeli airstrike on the town of Jouaiya in the southeastern Lebanese city of Tyre, Lebanese media reported.
The airstrike hit a house with three missiles in Jouaiya, killing Abu Talib, a senior military leader of the Lebanese... read full story"the crossing of 12 drones and about 80 surface-to-surface missiles from the Lebanese side to northern Israel,"

title: 4 US instructors wounded in China stabbing attack - Newspaper
message:
BEIJING: Four American instructors from a small Iowa university were wounded in a stabbing attack in a public park in northeast China’s Jilin province on Monday, prompting an investigation into the attacker’s motive, Chinese officials said.
The alleged assaults occurred shortly before noon on Monday at a park in Jilin City, police said.
A Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson, Lin Jian, said on Tuesday that police believed it was a random attack but authorities were still investigating.
US officials expressed dismay over the attack, and the State Department said it was in touch with local authorities and monitoring the situation.
“We are deeply concerned by the stabbing of US citizens in Jilin City, China,” White House National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan wrote on X on Tuesday.

title: India Nuclear Journey : From Pokhran to Global Power – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
India’s Nuclear Journey: From Pokhran to Global Power| BySOURCE: AFIThe journey began with the vision of physicist Homi Bhabha, who convinced Prime Minister Nehru to invest in nuclear technology despite international disapproval.
India’s first Peaceful Nuclear Explosion (PNE) in Pokhran in 1974 marked a significant achievement, but it also triggered international condemnation.
This resulted in exclusion from crucial nuclear groups like the NSG (Nuclear Suppliers Group) and CTBT (Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty).
India’s nuclear doctrine emphasizes “No First Use,” meaning it would only retaliate with nuclear weapons in response to a first strike by another nuclear state or a large-scale chemical/biological attack.
China, however, possesses a significantly larger arsenal (estimated at over 300 warheads), primarily aimed at deterring the US and its allies.

title: Woman found guilty in 2023 fatal Springfield nightclub stabbing
message:
SPRINGFIELD, Mass.
(WGGB/WSHM) - A woman found guilty of manslaughter on Tuesday in connection to a fatal stabbing in Springfield.
In January of last year, Springfield Police responded to the top shelf nightclub for reports of a stabbing victim.
Officers said the attack started outside the nightclub on chestnut street, and they found the victim in a parking lot across the street.
She pleaded not guilty to murder charges in January of 2023 and on Tuesday she has been found guilty of manslaughter.

title: The Latest | Rockets Fired from Lebanon after Israel Kills Hezbollah Commander
message:
Scores of rockets were fired from Lebanon toward northern Israel on Wednesday morning, hours after Israeli airstrikes killed four officials from the militant Hezbollah group including a senior military commander.
His death came amid rising escalation along the Lebanon-Israel border that has seen Hezbollah intensify its attacks on northern Israel while Israeli airstrikes have struck deep inside Lebanon.
Israel launched the war after Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack, in which militants stormed into southern Israel, killed some 1,200 people — mostly civilians — and abducted about 250.
Hezbollah’s Al-Manar TV reported that rockets were being fired from south Lebanon into northern Israel.
Hezbollah published a photo of Abdullah alongside Wissam al-Tawil, another senior commander killed in an Israeli strike in January.

title: Four US college instructors stabbed in public park in China
message:
Police in China have arrested a 55-year-old man after four US university tutors were stabbed at a public park.
The Iowa Cornell College instructors were taken to hospital after a "serious incident" during the daytime attack in the northern province of Jilin, a college statement said.
AdvertisementIowa Representative Adam Zabner said his brother, David, was one of the four instructors injured in what he described as a stabbing...On Tuesday, searches for terms such as "foreigners Jilin" produced no results despite the search term trending on Weibo.

title: HAL LCH to Test Helina Anti - Tank Missile – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
HAL’s LCH to Test Helina Anti-Tank Missile| BySOURCE: RAUNAK KUNDE / NEWS BEAT / IDRW.ORGHindustan Aeronautics Limited’s (HAL) indigenously developed Light Combat Helicopter (LCH), also known as Prachand, is poised for a crucial milestone later this year.
The helicopter will undergo integration and testing with the Helina Anti-Tank Guided Missile (ATGM), a key weapon system for the platform.
Helina, the helicopter-launched version of the Nag missile, has already been successfully test-fired from the ALH-Rudra attack helicopter.
Helina boasts advanced capabilities, making it a potent weapon for the LCH.
The successful integration of Helina will significantly enhance the Prachand’s combat capabilities, making it a more potent weapon system for the Indian Armed Forces.

title: Russian vessels conduct missile drills in Atlantic on way to Cuba
message:
A Russian naval frigate and a nuclear-powered submarine have conducted missile drills in the Atlantic Ocean while on their way to Cuba, the Russian Ministry of Defence has said.
The Admiral Gorshkov also conducted training in recent days to repel an air attack, the ministry said.
They are part of a group of four Russian vessels due to arrive in Cuba on Wednesday.
Cuba, Russia strong bilateral relationsThe Admiral Gorshkov is armed with new Zircon hypersonic missiles.
The Cuban Foreign Ministry said the Russian warships will be in Havana between Wednesday and June 17.

title: 19 - year - old killed in  explosion of gunfire  during Las Vegas marijuana transaction
message:
LAS VEGAS (KLAS) — Four people shot and killed a 19-year-old in “an explosion of gunfire” during a marijuana transaction, prosecutors said.
A Clark County grand jury later indicted Smith on charges including open murder and conspiracy murder.
Smith and three others allegedly conspired to rob Foreman during a marijuana transaction.
After meeting outside of the east valley apartment complex, the meeting turned into “an explosion of gunfire,” prosecutors said.
Four people shot and killed a 19-year-old in “an explosion of gunfire” during a marijuana transaction, prosecutors said.

title: J & K BJP Leader Stages Solitary Hunger Strike
message:
Senior BJP leader Khalid Jahangir staged a hunger strike on a road near the party's Church Lane office here, accusing Pakistan of causing the violence in J&K.
Jahangir, who ran unsuccessfully in the 2014 Assembly elections, claimed that by launching such heinous assaults, the neighboring country seeks to stifle the UT's economy.
“I vehemently condemn the terrorist attack on innocent pilgrims in Reasi.
In actuality, the neighboring nation, which opposes J&K's economic growth, is the one behind these instances,” the BJP leader told the media.
“It's not about politics; rather, it's about J&K's future, which is being severely jeopardised by the neighboring country and its proxies.

title: Iran seeks de - escalation on Israel - Lebanon border
message:
Smoke rises above Lebanon, following an Israeli strike, as seen from Israel's border with Lebanon in northern Israel, May 5, 2024.
Israeli military have said they are ready for cross-border attacks while Lebanon resistance forces said they will counter possible Israeli offensives, according to local media.
That's why, for the various reasons, Iran doesn't want to see an expansion of the conflict and war to Lebanon," he added.
Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said on June 10 that it shot down an Israeli drone over southern Lebanon.
All-out war with Hezbollah would draw Iran into the conflict, then who knows which Arab countries might want to side with them."

title: Iran seeks de - escalation on Israel - Lebanon border
message:
[Photo/Agencies]As tensions rise on the Israel-Lebanon border, Iran hopes the situation can be de-escalated and there is no new full-blown war in the region, with Israel urged not to launch any actions that infringe on Lebanon's territorial integrity.
Israeli military have said they are ready for cross-border attacks while Lebanon resistance forces said they will counter possible Israeli offensives, according to local media.
That's why, for the various reasons, Iran doesn't want to see an expansion of the conflict and war to Lebanon," he added.
Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said on June 10 that it shot down an Israeli drone over southern Lebanon.
All-out war with Hezbollah would draw Iran into the conflict, then who knows which Arab countries might want to side with them."

title: Russia launches missile and drone attack on Kyiv , Ukraine military says
message:
KYIV: Russia launched a missile and drone attack on Kyiv early on Wednesday (Jun 12) with preliminary information showing there were no injuries or damage in the Ukrainian capital, Ukrainian military said.
Ukraine's air defence systems destroyed all air weapons on their approach to the city, Serhiy Popko, head of Kyiv's military administration said on the Telegram messaging app.
He added that according to preliminary information, Russia used a combination of cruise and ballistic missiles as well as drones in its attack.
It was not immediately known whether there was any damage in the Kyiv region, which surrounds the capital and which is a separate administrative entity.
That is often the case when Russia launches an air attack on Ukraine's western regions.

title: Russia launches missile and drone attack on Kyiv , Ukraine military says
message:
Russia launched a missile and drone attack on Kyiv early on Wednesday with preliminary information showing there were no injuries or damage in the Ukrainian capital, Ukrainian military said.
Ukraine’s air defence systems destroyed all air weapons on their approach to the city, Serhiy Popko, head of Kyiv’s military administration said on the Telegram messaging app.
He added that according to preliminary information, Russia used a combination of cruise and ballistic missiles as well as drones in its attack.
Reuters could not independently verify what weapons were used, but Reuters witnesses said that several blasts that sounded like air defence systems at work were heard in and around Kyiv.
That is often the case when Russia launches an air attack on Ukraine’s western regions.

title: Russia launches missile and drone attack on Kyiv , Ukraine military says
message:
KYIV (Reuters) -Russia launched missile and drone attacks on Ukraine early on Wednesday, causing a fire at an industrial facility, damaging residences and injuring several people across six regions, local authorities said.
Ukraine's air defence systems destroyed all air weapons on their approach to the capital, Serhiy Popko, head of Kyiv city military administration said on the Telegram messaging app.
The debris damaged an industrial facility in the Kyiv region, causing a fire, Kyiv region governor said.
Dnipropetrovsk governor said the attack injured three people and damaged nine private residences, reporting that Ukrainian military shot down 11 drones over his region.
That is often the case when Russia launches an air attack on Ukraine's western regions.

title: Three FC men injured in IED attack near Kuchlak - Newspaper
message:
QUETTA: Three Frontier Corps personnel have been injured in an IED attack near Kuchlak at the Quetta-Chaman Highway late on Tuesday night.
According to officials, the IED exploded close to the personnel’s vehicle, which was damaged as a result of the powerful blast.
The window panes of a nearby building were smashed due to the explosion’s intensity.
Police and FC personnel shifted the injured soldiers to Quetta’s Combined Military Hospital.
“It seems like a remote control IED blast,” a senior police officer posted in Kuchlak told Dawn.

title: Can China Turn Its Property Glut Into Affordable Housing ?
message:
China currently has 3.6 billion square feet—or roughly 5.5 million homes—of unsold housing inventory due to the collapse of its property bubble.
Nationwide, that could raise the percentage of affordable housing from just 5 percent of China’s stock to 30 percent.
Unfortunately, affordable housing projects in China do not have a good record.
Even when affordable housing was built, it was often distributed to the well-connected rather than the needy, including officials and their families.
Another common dodge was for developers to get the money and permits to build affordable housing and then switch most of it to conventional commercial use upon launch, only retaining a small number of affordable residential units.

title: Media : Explosions reported across occupied Crimea , Krasnodar Krai
message:
Explosions were heard in missile attacks in multiple cities across occupied Crimea, as well as in a community in Russia's Krasnodar Krai overnight on June 12, the Telegram channel Crimean Wind reported.
A small number of explosions was also heard in the community of Armyanskii in Russia's Krasnodar Krai around 4 a.m. local time, according to Crimean Wind.
According to Crimean Wind, unconfirmed reports suggest that an S-400 air defense system may have been damaged as a result of the attack.
Ukraine's General Staff confirmed on June 10 that Armed Forces attacked Russian S-400 and S-300 anti-aircraft missile systems in several areas in occupied Crimea overnight.
Read also: Russia has seized almost $24 million in Ukrainian assets from occupied Crimea since 2022, proxy leader saysWe’ve been working hard to bring you independent, locally-sourced news from Ukraine.

message:

70-year-old man stabbed in 'revenge' in Delhi, accused heldA 42-year-old man, Amit, was arrested for stabbing a 70-year-old in Shastri Nagar, north Delhi.
The attack was in revenge for mistreatment of his female friend, a maid at the victim's home.
Ludhiana: The anti-narcotics cell of Ludhiana police commissionerate arrested a man with illegal weapons .Jaswinder Singh alias Jassi, a driver from Sangowal village, was arrested with a .32-bore country-made pistol and four bullets in Geetika Valley, after a tip-off.ASI Raj Kumar, investigating officer, said the accused is already facing trial in five cases, including two of attempt to murder.
The accused, during interrogation, revealed that he bought the pistol for self-defence because of rivalry.

title: BJP accuses Ktaka govt of Taliban - style administration : LoP
message:
BJP accuses K’taka govt of Taliban-style administration: LoPA A ATeam Udayavani, Jun 12, 2024, 2:01 PM ISTMangaluru: The Congress government in Karnataka is running a Taliban-style administration, alleged a Leader of Opposision R Ashoka at a recent press conference.
He highlighted a specific incident in Boliyar, where BJP workers chanting “Bharat Mata Ki Jai” were allegedly attacked in a pre-planned act.
The BJP plans to hold a meeting tomorrow in Bengaluru under the leadership of the state president to discuss their strategy.
He assured BJP workers that the party stands firmly with them and will provide assistance as needed.
Criticizing the Congress government’s performance over the past year, he stated, “The achievement of the state Congress in the last one year is zero.

title: The Cranes Call  Review : Tribeca Hunt for Russian War Criminals
message:
If you walked into a theater showing Laura Warner’s “The Cranes Call” by accident, two things would happen.
“The Cranes Call” is the latest documentary about the ongoing, horrifying Russian invasion of Ukraine.
It follows Anya Neistat, a human rights activist working for the Clooney Foundation for Justice, run by Amal Clooney and her husband George.
Whether that day will come, Neistat and Stasiv do not know.
The visual approach vaunts Neistat and Stasiv a little, but given their chosen profession and nearly impossible tasks, that’s understandable.

title: Convicted killer Paul Flores moved to another prison over safety concerns
message:
Kristin Smart's killer, Paul Flores, has been moved to a new prison for safety reasons.
The move comes after Flores was attacked twice at Pleasant Valley State Prison in Coalinga.
In April of this year, prison staff reportedly witnessed another inmate stabbing Flores in the recreation yard.
According to his attorney, Harold Mesick, Flores was moved to Corcoran State Prison on June 6.
Flores was initially placed at Pleasant Valley State Prison last August to begin serving his 25 years-to-life sentence for Smart's murder.

title: Chicago crime : South Loop man Ivan Weldon charged in 3 CTA Green Line attacks
message:
South Loop man charged in 3 CTA Green Line attacksCHICAGO -- A South Loop man remains jailed on attempted murder and battery charges in connection with several attacks on CTA passengers.
Ivan Weldon, 42, is accused of using a box cutter to slice a 48-year-old man's neck and stabbing him multiple times May 31 on a Green Line train near the Garfield station, 320 E. Garfield Boulevard.
Weldon faces three felony charges in connection with that attack: attempted murder, aggravated battery in a public place and aggravated battery causing great bodily harm.
On the same day, Weldon allegedly attacked two more passengers at the CTA Green Line Bronzeville stop, 16 E. 35th St.
Two felony counts each of aggravated battery in a public place and aggravated battery were filed in those attacks.

title: Russian military exercises in the Caribbean : Here what to expect
message:
Three Russian ships and a nuclear-powered submarine are expected to arrive in Cuba this week ahead of military exercises in the Caribbean, officials said.
What Russian ships are arriving in Cuba?
According to the Cuban Foreign Ministry, the three Russian ships are a frigate, a fleet oil tanker and a salvage tug.
Another destroyer and a U.S. Coast Guard cutter are shadowing the three Russian ships.
The two U.S. officials said Tuesday the Russian ships are expected to head to Venezuela after Cuba, but it's unclear what the submarine will do.

title: Man who led SLO County police on chase during 2023 crime spree sentenced
message:
San Luis Obispo County District Attorney Dan Dow announced Tuesday the sentencing of a Visalia man who led county law enforcement on a chase during a 2023 crime spree.
Joshua Lee Arnold was sentenced to serve 26 years plus 28 years to life in prison for attempted murder and assault with a handgun during a crime spree.
It happened on August 17, 2023, when at approximately 1:00 pm, Arnold attempted to rob a clerk at a 7-Eleven in Grover Beach.
Multiple agencies assisted in the investigation, including the Grover Beach Police Department, the San Luis Obispo County Sheriff’s Office, the San Luis Obispo Police Department, and the San Luis Obispo County District Attorney’s Office Bureau of Investigation.
On April 9, 2024, Arnold pleaded no contest to three counts of attempted murder with deliberation and premeditation, and two counts of assault with a semiautomatic firearm.

title: Charges filed in series of CTA Green Line attacks – NBC Chicago
message:
A South Loop man remains jailed on attempted murder and battery charges in connection with several attacks on CTA passengers.
Weldon faces three felony charges in connection with that attack: attempted murder, aggravated battery in a public place and aggravated battery causing great bodily harm.
On the same day, Weldon allegedly attacked two more passengers at the CTA Green Line Bronzeville stop, 16 E. 35th St.
Weldon punched another man in the face at the Bronzeville station as the man was trying to get on a train, prosecutors allege.
Two felony counts each of aggravated battery in a public place and aggravated battery were filed in those attacks.

title: Third Terror Attack in Jammu In 48 Hours : Police And Army Joint Naka In Doda Latest Target Of Ultras
message:
The terror attack in Chattergala in J&K’s Doda district was reported within hours of a attack by the ultras at a village near the International Border (IB) in Kathua district.
Jammu: Terrorists opened fire at a police and army team in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district on Wednesday midnight - the third terror incident in the region in a span of 48 hours.
The police and army team at the joint naka promptly retaliated to their fire and killed a terrorist, officials said.
The terror attack in Chattergala in J&K’s Doda district was reported within hours of an attack by the ultras at a village near the International Border (IB) in Kathua district.
It was the first major attack near the Pir Panjal range since 2003, when it witnessed a high peak of terror activities.

title: Tops gunman lawyers file to exempt him from the death penalty
message:
Attorneys representing the Tops massacre gunman are trying to exempt their client from the death penalty.
In a separate federal case, the Department of Justice filed a notice to seek the death penalty for Gendron back in January.
But lawyers representing Gendron argue he should be exempt from that punishment on account of his age at the time of the alleged capital crimes.
Gendron was 18 years old at the time of the attack, and so meets the minimum legal age limit to face the death penalty when tried for capital offences in the U.S..
Therefore - his lawyers argue - the government should be barred from seeking the death penalty in the case.

title: Tops gunman lawyers file to exempt him from the death penalty
message:
Attorneys representing the Tops massacre gunman are trying to exempt their client from the death penalty.
In a separate federal case, the Department of Justice filed a notice to seek the death penalty for Gendron back in January.
But lawyers representing Gendron argue he should be exempt from that punishment on account of his age at the time of the alleged capital crimes.
Gendron was 18 years old at the time of the attack, and so meets the minimum legal age limit to face the death penalty when tried for capital offences in the U.S..
Therefore - his lawyers argue - the government should be barred from seeking the death penalty in the case.

title: WATCH : Alleged Mountain View  don  gunned down on Windward Road
message:
KINGSTON, Jamaica – An alleged ‘don’ was killed in a brazen afternoon shooting on Windward Road on Tuesday.
Observer Online understands that the deceased, identified thus far by his alias, ‘Dangles, hailed from Mountain View.
He was reportedly gunned down in an attack carried out by armed motorcyclists.
According to eyewitness, two men drove up alongside the vehicle the now-deceased was travelling and opened fire.
The vehicle then crashed into an embankment in the area.

title: China arrests a man in connection to stabbing of 4 U . S . college instructors
message:
Four U.S. instructors from a college in Iowa were injured in a stabbing in China, Chinese authorities said.
Police in the northeastern Chinese province of Jilin said on Tuesday the four victims are receiving medical care for non-life-threatening wounds and that they arrested a man in connection to the stabbing.
The four instructors were visiting China from Cornell College, a small private liberal arts college in Mount Vernon, Iowa, which has had an academic partnership with Beihua University in Jilin since 2018.
One of the stabbing victims, David Zabner, spoke to NPR member station Iowa Public Radio from a hospital about the incident.
But analyst say that anti-Western sentiment in China, bolstered by growing nationalism and COVID-era restrictions, has been growing in recent years.

title: Vt . woman serving time for attempted murder accused of attacking cellmate
message:
SOUTH BURLINGTON, Vt. (WCAX) - A woman behind bars for attempted murder faces new charges after authorities say she attacked her cellmate.
Vermont State Police say it happened just before 5 a.m. at the Chittenden Regional Correctional Facility in South Burlington on May 29.
They say Veronica Lewis, 40, used a facility-issued tablet and a lock inside a sock to attack her sleeping cellmate, Yvonne Frederikson, 52.
Police say Frederikson was sent to the hospital with serious injuries.
She’s already serving time for attempted murder after shooting her firearms instructor in 2015.

title: Exchanges wont be disrupted by isolated incident
message:
Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian.
The four educators are from Cornell College in the US state of Iowa and were on a teaching exchange program with Beihua University.
Lin said the isolated incident will not disrupt normal exchanges of people from China and the US.
The partnership between Cornell College and Beihua University began in 2018, The New York Times quoted Jan Visser, a spokeswoman for Cornell College, as saying.
Beihua University provides funding for the college's professors to travel to and live in China, and teach computer science, mathematics and physics over a two-week period.

title: Senior Hezbollah commander Abu Taleb killed by Israeli strike in south Lebanon

Israel said about 90 projectiles were fired from Lebanon, while Hezbollah said it had launched dozens of rockets at various targets.
A Lebanese military source told AFP that the commander was “the most important in Hezbollah to be killed up to now since the start of the war”.
Mr Abdallah, who Hezbollah said was 55, was killed in the village of Jouaiya, about 15km from the Israeli border.
In southern Lebanon, about 300 Hezbollah fighters have been killed since the conflict broke out, along with about 80 civilians.
In northern Israel, Hezbollah attacks have killed 18 Israeli soldiers and 10 civilians, Israel says.

title: From the physics of g - force to weightlessness : How it feels to launch into space
message:
This summer, NPR science podcast Short Wave is launching Space Camp, a series about all the weird and wonderful things in our universe.
G-forces and why floating is fallingWhen those rockets blast off, astronauts experience intense g-forces.
But the heaviness of being in a fast elevator is nothing compared to what astronauts experience during a launch.
Preview of Next Week's Short Wave Space Camp: PlutoNow if we get out of Earth's orbit and to the end of our solar system, we will pass the beloved once-planet Pluto.
Listen to every episode of Short Wave sponsor-free and support our work at NPR by signing up for Short Wave+ at plus.npr.org/shortwave.

title: Be firm and prosecute suspect who stabbed Hawa Koomson son – NPP to IGP
message:
Politics of Wednesday, 12 June 2024Source: kasapafmonline.comThe Central Regional branch of the Patriotic Party (NPP) has called on the IGP, Dr. George Akuffo Dampare, to ensure that the suspect who stabbed the son of the Minister for Fisheries and Aquaculture, Mavis Hawa Koomson, is prosecuted.
The party has condemned the stabbing incident that occurred at the EC Registration Centre during the ongoing limited voter's transfer last week.
Addressing a press conference at the NPP party office in Kasoa, Central Regional NPP Secretary, Richard Takyi Mensah, condemned the unfortunate incident and called on the IGP to stand firm and prosecute the suspect to serve as a deterrent to others.
This behavior is unacceptable, and we roundly condemn the stabbing incident," he added.
She affirmed that the Awutu Senya East seat is safe under the leadership of Mavis Hawa Koomson.

title: Unyielding onslaught - Newspaper
message:
That same night, policemen successfully defended their post in Bajaur from a militant attack with no loss of lives.
Several pivotal developments have led to the resurgence of terrorist activities in Pakistan, notably the Afghan Taliban’s takeover of Kabul in 2021.
And so, an emboldened TTP has been able to regroup and mount sophisticated attacks against targets inside Pakistan.
To counter this escalating threat, Pakistan must develop a strategy that integrates both military and civilian efforts.
All the while, diplomatic efforts must continue to exert pressure on the Afghan Taliban to take concrete actions against the TTP.

title: US to provide another Patriot system to Ukraine : Report
message:
US to provide another Patriot system to Ukraine: Report.
Image Source: IANS NewsWashington, June 12 : US President Joe Biden is planning to make another Patriot air defence system available to Ukraine to fend off Russian aerial attacks, the media reported, citing unnamed US government sources.
Biden took the decision following several high-level meetings last week, the New York Times reported on Tuesday.
According to the New York Times, the system in question is in Poland and could be deployed to the front line in Ukraine within days.
If confirmed it would be the second US-made Patriot system provided to Kiev by Washington.

title: US To Provide Another Patriot System To Ukraine : Report
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Washington, June 12 (IANS/DPA) US President Joe Biden is planning to make another Patriot air defence system available to Ukraine to fend off Russian aerial attacks, the reported, citing unnamed US sources.
Biden took the decision following several high-level meetings last week, the New York Times reported on Tuesday.
According to the New York Times, the system in question is in Poland and could be deployed to the front line in Ukraine within days.
If confirmed it would be the second US-made Patriot system provided to Kiev by Washington.
Germany has also provided Ukraine with two such systems and pledged to send another one.

title: Metal Gear Solid Fans Love the New Game Battle Damage Feature
message:
One of the most notable partner showcases was Konami's Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater.
Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Battle Damage UpgradeOne of the big additions Konami made with the original Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater was the battle damage system.
With Metal Gear Solid Delta, the team is taking that system one step further to finally show some of that damage.
Touches like this have fans very excited to play Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater.
Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater launches later this year on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC

title: China dismisses Taiwan concerns after man arrested on river leading to Taipei
message:
Taiwan's coast guard arrested the man on Sunday in the coastal neighbourhood of Tamsui after his boat entered a river that leads into Taipei amid ongoing tensions between Taiwan and China.
Taiwan says the man is a former Chinese navy captain who could have been probing the island's defences.
Speaking at a regular news briefing in Beijing, Chen Binhua, spokesperson for China's Taiwan Affairs Office, said what the man had done was "purely his personal action".
The man will be punished once he returns to China, Chen added, without giving details.
Taiwan's coast guard said that the man crossed the strait from China's Fujian province, which sits opposite Taiwan, and that it does not believe he came to Taiwan seeking political asylum.

title: Assassin Creed Shadows 13 - min . walkthrough shows combat & more
message:
Assassin’s Creed Shadows is due out on November 15, but Ubisoft saw fit to give players a taste of the game early through a 13-minute extended walkthrough.
For players eager to step into the role of Naoe and Yasuke, the extended gameplay walkthrough is a must-watch.
Ubisoft discusses more of this world in a developer insight video which it released alongside the extended gameplay walkthrough.
Most of this video is just Dansereau alongside Game Director Charles Benoit breaking down the extended gameplay walkthrough.
Assassin’s Creed Shadows launches on November 15 for PC via Ubisoft Connect, and Ubisoft+ Premium members will be able to play the game through that service.

title: Ukraine war briefing : Washington clears Azov brigade for US weapons and training
message:
The US has lifted a ban on providing weapons and training to Ukraine’s Azov Brigade, which had far-right roots but proved key to the defence of the major port city of Mariupol.
Azov was absorbed into Ukraine’s national guard as the 12th Special Forces Brigade and current members reject accusations of extremism and ties with far-right movements.
US law prohibits providing equipment and training to foreign military units or individuals suspected of committing gross human rights violations.
“This is a new page in our unit’s history,” the Azov Brigade said in a statement.
Speaking in Madrid recently, Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, said Ukraine needed another seven Patriot systems to defend against Russian strikes.

title: Bizarre psychological warfare using K - pop and trash balloons raises tensions between the 2 Koreas | News , Sports , Jobs
message:
SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — Mammoth South Korean loudspeakers blaring BTS music.
Small South Korean civilian leaflets slamming North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.
North Korean broadcasts in the past revolved mainly around praising its system and harsh censuring of South Korea.
They said past North Korean broadcasts from its loudspeakers were not clearly audible in South Korean areas.

title: Depressing : US Soldiers More Likely to Die by Suicide Than in Combat
message:
One of the most alarming statistics reveals that U.S. soldiers were more likely to die by suicide than from combat industries.
Soldiers were nine times more likely to die in that manner.
The suicide figures from 2019 predate some Army and Pentagon initiatives to combat suicide, including a workforce that addresses harmful behaviors like alcohol abuse that can contribute to deaths by suicide.
In one sense, the ratio of suicides to combat deaths is probably not an ideal indicator.
After all, we're no longer actively involved in any hot wars (at least for the moment) so the rate of combat deaths should be lower.

message:

title: Biden Still Thinks He Can Win a Civil War
message:

title: Democracy Under Siege . Ursula Von der Leyen and Dr . Egon Cholakian on Combating Hybrid Warfare and Disinformation
message:
Today, the need for immediate action to defend democracy is not just a […]The upcoming European Parliament elections are set for June 6-9.
Today, many experts agree that democracy faces hybrid warfare, which includes elements of information warfare and economic and political manipulations.
In his latest analytical video report, Dr. Egon Cholakian presents the results of an extensive 30-year investigation into this issue and discusses the existence of a hidden anti-democratic entity within democratic countries.
The report explores disinformation methods using the example of a deliberate 10-year campaign aimed at discrediting the ALLATRA International Public Movement.
Ursula von der Leyen proposes creating a European Democratic Shield, which will identify and eliminate online disinformation based on the EU’s digital rules and the Digital Services Act.

title: German MPs boycott Zelensky speech - Newspaper
message:
BERLIN: Far-right and left-wing nationalist lawmakers in Germany, boycotted a parliamentary address by the Ukrainian President, Volody­myr Zelensky, on Tuesday.
In his speech, Zelensky warned that ‘pro-Russian rhetoric’, posed a ‘growing danger’, to nations in the EU.
Zelensky’s speech came at the start of a diplomatic whirlwind tour, to shore up support for Kyiv’s battle against Russia.
But radical pro-Russian rhetoric is dangerous for your countries,” Zelensky warned.
The co-leaders of the AfD stated that they “refused to listen to a speaker wearing camouflage fatigues”.

title: War in Ukraine : Two Indian nationals recruited by Russia killed
message:
"We regret to state that two Indian nationals who had been recruited by the Russian Army have recently been killed in the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine," the foreign ministry statement said, without naming the victims.
The ministry also urged Indian nationals to "exercise caution while seeking employment opportunities in Russia".
Despite urging Russia to return Indian nationals serving in the Russian army, India has refused to condemn the Kremlin over its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, urging the two sides to seek peace through dialogue and diplomacy.
At least 16 former Sri Lankan soldiers have been killed in the conflict so far, most of them for the Russian army.
Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Ali Sabry raised the issue with his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov in Moscow on Monday, the ministry said.

title: US to widen sanctions on sale of semiconductor chips to Russia
message:
The US government plans on Wednesday (12 June) to announce wider sanctions on the sale of semiconductor chips and other goods to Russia, with the goal of targeting third-party sellers in China, sources familiar with the plans said late on Tuesday.
The administration will announce it is broadening existing export controls to include US-branded goods, not just those made in the United States, the sources said.
The White House and Commerce Department had no immediate comment on the changes, which were first reported by Bloomberg.
White House spokesperson John Kirby told reporters earlier Tuesday that Washington would announce new sanctions and export controls against Russia.
US officials have expressed growing frustration about China’s burgeoning trade with Russia, which they say is allowing Moscow to keep arming its military.

title: Key Sudanese city could fall to rebels imminently - US
message:
(AFP)The United States' envoy to Sudan has warned that El Fasher, a besieged city in western Darfur, could fall to rebel forces imminently.
El Fasher is the only city still under army control in the western Darfur region.
America's warning about the fall of El Fasher follows weeks of bloody fighting in the city.
El Fasher had been a sanctuary for many who had fled their homes because of the conflict.
The constant shelling in El Fasher has sent tens of thousands fleeing once again.

title: Vietnam veteran fulfills goal of graduating high school at Commonwealth Charter Academy after dropping out
message:
77-year-old Vietnam vet graduates high school years after dropping out to go to war77-year-old Vietnam vet graduates high school years after dropping out to go to war77-year-old Vietnam vet graduates high school years after dropping out to go to warPHILADELPHIA (CBS) -- A 77-year-old Vietnam veteran graduated Tuesday with the Commonwealth Charter Academy's class of 2024.
The year was 1965, the United States was 10 years into the Vietnam War and 17-year-old Robert Toporek dropped out of high school in Charleston, South Carolina, to join the Army.
In the heat of the combat zone, Toporek still managed to pass his GED test.
Despite earning the Purple Heart and Bronze Star for his bravery in Vietnam, writing two books and being an early childhood education expert, Toporek said he's missed many opportunities because he didn't have a high school diploma.
As he delivered a speech to the class of 2024, Toporek used his own journey to graduation as a teachable moment.

title: China overseas bases arent a big threat yet : RAND
message:
China’s growing interest in opening more military bases abroad does not pose a big threat to U.S. forces in the next six years, RAND concludes in a new report out Monday.
“Recent PLA research on overseas bases describes the ability to project power and win potentially protracted wars in distant theaters as a vital but likely still-distant capability.
One reason is that China doesn’t have the same sort of sophisticated command and control structures overseas that the United States does.
Perhaps for that reason, the researchers didn’t find any PLA writing that describes conducting military operations from overseas bases aimed at the United States.
Still, a network of overseas bases could pose indirect security challenges to the United States by complicating U.S. defense planning in the highly insecure and conflict-prone countries,” they note.

title: Whither Europe ? - Newspaper
message:
There were those in Europe who relished the prospect of a combat between the USSR and Nazi Germany, and the Normandy landings were at least partly motivated by the fear that the Red Army would overrun Europe and take sole credit for Hitler’s defeat.
Stalin’s regime is accurately accused of imposing its will on Eastern Europe.
Somewhat more subtly, the US did the same in Western Europe.
Meloni postures on the international stage as the acceptable face of Europe’s far right, while her government’s domestic attitudes reflect a clearer image of its perverse inclinations.
In many parts of Europe, for instance, economic distress is related to ageing societies and diminishing populations.

title: During June , some weigh in on PTSD Awareness Month
message:
BINGHAMTON (WBNG) -- June is PTSD awareness month, which raises awareness of the disorder millions of people across the United States battle with every day.
Tierney Daniels, the daughter of United States Veteran Eric Daniels said.
“You could definitely tell that he doesn’t think like how a normal person thinks,” Tierney Daniels, the daughter of United States Veteran Eric Daniels said.
“I think people don’t realize how real it is and how many people struggle genuinely with PTSD.
Not even just vets like people every day have PTSD,” said Daniels.

title: North Korean Soldiers Crossing Border Was A Mistake : Seoul After Illegal Entry Reports
message:
North Korean soldiers breached the South border Photo : APSouth Korea clarified that North Korean soldiers crossing its border was simply 'a mistake', further adding that the 20-odd troops were 'not all armed' and returned promptly after a warning fire.
On Tuesday, South Korean military confirmed that it fired warning shots after 20-30 North Korean troops briefly violated the tense border earlier in the week.
According to the military statement, at 12:30 PM on Sunday, some North Korean soldiers who were engaged in unspecified work on the northern side of the border crossed the military demarcation line that bisects the two countries.
The soldiers immediately returned to their territory after South Korea’s military fired warning shots and issued warning broadcasts, the Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
The 248-kilometer (155-mile) -long, 4-kilometer (2.5-mile) -wide DMZ is the world’s most heavily armed border.

title: The Garhwal Regiment glorious military heritage
message:
The sprawling Bungalow No 6 amongst a hundred such, constructed in 1906 was home to Colonel Mainwaring commandant of 3/9 Royal Garhwal Rifles and was bought by MES for a princely Rs 10,053!
Scattered but indistinguishable descendants of erstwhile Nepalese can be found in Pathankot village as are remnants of 2/3 Gorkha Rifles also raised here which have an umbilical cord with the Garhwal Regiment.
It was a silver replica of this Unknown Soldier that PM Modi presented to the PM of France in 2015 to commemorate the centenary of WWI.
The Darwan Singh War Museum is the grand repository of the history and achievements in war and peace of the Regiment.
The Garhwal regimental legacy is protected by its three symbols: Lord Badrinath, the regimental deity, the iconic Unknown Soldier and the Royal Rassi.

title: Ex - Navy employee pleads guilty to taking bribes from defense contractors
message:
SAN DIEGO (CNS) — A former San Diego-based Navy civilian employee pleaded guilty this week to accepting bribes from defense contractors to help them obtain hundreds of millions of dollars in government contracts.
Prosecutors said that one family friend who received a job through the scheme gave Soriano $2,000 a month from her salary.
In addition to the bribery conspiracy, Soriano pleaded guilty to filing a false tax return for not disclosing the cash payments he received from his family friend.
Soriano's plea agreement states he and another former Navy employee took bribes from Philip Flores, the president and CEO of Virginia-based Intellipeak Solutions.
Cambridge International Systems pleaded guilty to federal charges earlier this year.

title: Ann Wagner joins bipartisan U . S . House caucus planning for post - war Middle East
message:
A U.S. House caucus formed this month with the goal of planning for the region after the Israel-Hamas war ends.
Blinken told reporters in Tel Aviv Tuesday that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu “reaffirmed” his commitment to the proposal.
The Israel-Hamas war has been ongoing since Hamas militants infiltrated Israel’s southern border on Oct. 7, killing roughly 1,200, according to Israel’s figures.
The death toll from Israel’s continued offensive in the Palestinian territory of Gaza reached 36,379 at the end of May, according to the Health Ministry in the Gaza Strip run by the Hamas-controlled government.
The post Ann Wagner joins bipartisan U.S. House caucus planning for post-war Middle East appeared first on Missouri Independent.

title: In shadow of war , Lebanese find respite on southern beach
message:
Life goes on but "the children are frightened", the 60-year-old told AFP from the beach in Tyre, about 20 kilometres (12.4 miles) from the Israel-Lebanon frontier.
Lebanon's Hezbollah, a Hamas ally, and Israel have been trading near-daily fire since the Gaza war was trigged by the Palestinian militant group's October 7 attack on southern Israel.
"Let them (Israel) sit with their fear and we will sit with a beer," he added.
Summer tourism, in large part driven by Lebanese expatriates, is a crucial source of income for Tyre residents and small businesses.
"Despite the security situation... people (in the south) have no other outlet but this beach," he said.

title: US Plans  Hellscape  Drone Swarm In A Taiwan War
message:
(MENAFN- Asia Times) The US plans to turn the Taiwan Strait into a“Hellscape” of drone swarms against a possible Chinese invasion of Taiwan, buying time for US and allied intervention to assist the beleaguered self-governing island in a war scenario.
This month, The Washington Post reported that the US Indo-Pacific Command, led by Admiral Samuel Paparo, has announced a“Hellscape” strategy to use drone swarms to thwart any potential Chinese invasion of Taiwan.
For instance, Asia Times has noted that the US Navy's drone budget would fall to US$101.8 million in 2025, down from $172 million this year.
The US has thusly surged the development and deployment of drone swarms in the Pacific through its Replicator Program.
In September 2023, Asia Times reported that the US Department of Defense (DOD) had introduced the Replicator Program to accelerate the deployment of autonomous expendable platforms for air, land and sea operations.

title: Ukraine Azov hails US lifting weapons ban
message:
Ukraine’s Azov hails US lifting weapons banThe original "Azov battalion" was blighted by accusations that some members held openly far-right and extremist views.
(Photo by Roman PILIPEY / AFP)Ukraine’s Azov brigade on Tuesday welcomed Washington’s decision to allow it access to US military aid, lifting a decade-long ban imposed over the unit’s initial hardline nationalist ideology.
The US State Department said it had conducted a “thorough review” of the current Azov brigade and found “no evidence” of human rights violations.
Washington also said the current Azov brigade is different from the initial militia unit, meaning it can access US-supplied weapons.
“This is a new page in the history of our brigade,” Azov said on social media.

title: Afghanistan war vet Sam Brown secures Republican nomination in Nevada Senate primary
message:
Sam Brown defeated his Republican rivals in Nevada’s Senate primary Tuesday and will face incumbent Sen. Jacky Rosen (D-Nevada) in November.
Brown, a Purple Heart and Bronze Star recipient who served in the war in Afghanistan, received 56.8% of the GOP primary vote.
X / @CaptainSamBrownOn the Democratic side, Rosen easily defeated her primary opponents, winning with 92.5% of the vote.
The Nevada Senate race could determine which party controls the upper chamber next year, and the Silver State appears to be leaning red in 2024.
Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto (D-Nevada) narrowly defeated Trump-backed Republican Adam Laxalt in Nevada’s 2022 Senate race, beating the state’s former attorney general by less than 1 percentage point.

title: Multibillion - euro court battle over jets stranded in Russia begins in Dublin
message:
Some of the world’s largest aircraft lessors faced off against their insurers in a Dublin courtroom on Tuesday (11 June) at the start of a months-long battle over around €2.5 billion of insurance claims related to jets stranded in Russia.
Lloyd’s of London, Chubband Fidelis are among the insurers contesting the claims.
Others have argued that lessors voluntarily ended leasing agreements or that Western sanctions prevent insurers from providing cover.
The world’s biggest aircraft lessor, Irish-based AerCap, is pursuing its insurance claims through London’s High Court, with what its lawyers have described as a “mega trial” due to start in October.
Since launching their lawsuits, lessors have secured settlements with Russia totalling more than $2.5 billion for more than 100 jets, with ownership transferred to Russian airlines.

title: 29th Marine Commandant Al Gray personal items set for auction
message:
Quinn’s Auction Galleries will auction items from the estate of the 29th Marine Corps Commandant Gen. Al Gray and his late wife Jan Gray.
A separate auction scheduled for Thursday contains the general’s personal Marine Corps and military service items.
A glass hand grenade among the items for auction in the estate sale of the late Gen. Al Gray, 29th Marine Corps Commandant.
He continued his connection to the Corps through a variety of nonprofits and charities such as the Marine Corps Association and Foundation.
The dog tags of the late Gen. Al Gray, 29th Marine Corps commandant, part of an estate auction in June.

title: In shadow of war , Lebanese find respite on southern beach
message:
Life goes on but "the children are frightened", the 60-year-old told AFP from the beach in Tyre, about 20 kilometres (12.4 miles) from the Israel-Lebanon frontier.
Lebanon's Hezbollah, a Hamas ally, and Israel have been trading near-daily fire since the Gaza war was trigged by the Palestinian militant group's October 7 attack on southern Israel.
"Let them (Israel) sit with their fear and we will sit with a beer," he added.
Summer tourism, in large part driven by Lebanese expatriates, is a crucial source of income for Tyre residents and small businesses.
"Despite the security situation... people (in the south) have no other outlet but this beach," he said.

title: The Acolyte  Episode 3 Ending Explained : How Were the Twins Conceived ?
message:
However, The Acolyte Episode 3 “Destiny” takes us back sixteen years in the past to show us what really went down on Mae and Osha’s homeworld of Brendok…or does it?
**Spoilers for The Acolyte Episode 3 “Destiny,” now streaming on Disney+**The Acolyte Episode 3 “Destiny” shows us a pivotal day in the lives of young twins Mae (Leah Brady) and Osha (Lauren Brady).
Here’s what you need to know about The Acolyte Episode 3…Photo: Disney+The Acolyte Episode 3 Ending Explained: Did The Jedi Kill the Coven?
So what really happened in The Acolyte Episode 3 “Destiny?” Well, it’s looking an awful lot like the Jedi did in fact murder Mae and Osha’s family.
Here’s hoping we get more information on how Mae and Osha were conceived and how it might be connected to Anakin.

title: The Challenge : All Stars 5 spoilers reveal another former show winner returned for spinoff
message:
The Challenge: All Stars 5 appears to have several controversial or polarizing cast members as part of the latest spinoff show.
The Challenge brings back show winner for All Stars 5Cast member spoilers for The Challenge often change based on the availability of information.
Turbo, a former Survivor: Turkey winner, debuted as a rookie on The Challenge: War of the Worlds.
An Instagram screenshot features former The Challenge winner Turbo.
The former Challenge winner will team up with his former friendMTV brought him back for Ride or Dies, where he arrived with his friend Tamara Alfaro as his teammate.

title: F1 news - Max Verstappen explains Russell - pleasing swerve , Canada GP advice
message:
We have another batch of major Formula 1 headlines for you in the Tuesday news round-up, fresh off of a thrilling Canadian Grand Prix.
Max Verstappen has been talking us through his fast reactions which saved a groundhog, and delighted George Russell, who received some crucial advice from the Championship leader after a chance to win the Canadian Grand Prix agonisingly slipped away.
But, seeing Russell was “a bit upset”, Verstappen looked to reassure the Brit, as “these things can happen”.
But, with Red Bull exercising an option in Tsunoda’s contract for 2025, the Japanese racer confirmed that the pressure remains on, as he has been given no assurances on his Red Bull status for 2026.
Read more – Yuki Tsunoda shares crucial contract detail after signing new Red Bull deal

title: Santa Clarita Grocery Volunteer Shares First - Hand Account of Battle Of The Bulge
message:
A volunteer with the Santa Clarita Grocery told his first-hand account as a child in Belgium during the Battle of the Bulge.
German soldiers still used horses against modern cars and tanks the American soldiers were equipped with.
Get breaking KHTS Santa Clarita News Alerts delivered right to your inbox.
Santa Clarita news and features are delivered throughout the day over our airwaves, on our website and through a variety of social media platforms.
A vibrant member of the Santa Clarita community, the KHTS broadcast signal reaches all of the Santa Clarita Valley and parts of the high desert communities located in the Antelope Valley.
